title: Build countdown timer application with Agent Mail integration
description:
## Feature Request

Build a real-world countdown timer application that demonstrates Agent Mail integration for cross-agent communication and coordination.

## Motivation

Agent Mail (https://github.com/Dicklesworthstone/mcp_agent_mail) is an MCP server that enables AI agents to communicate asynchronously via a message queue system. Building a countdown timer application serves multiple purposes:

1. **Learn Agent Mail**: Practical experience with MCP-based agent communication
2. **Real Application**: Create a useful tool (multiple timers with alarms)
3. **Demonstrate Coordination**: Show how agents can coordinate on building a complete application
4. **Test Workflow**: Exercise beads issue tracking in a realistic development scenario

## Use Cases

1. **Multiple Timers**: User can create multiple countdown timers running simultaneously
2. **Timer Management**: Start, pause, resume, cancel, and reset individual timers
3. **Visual Display**: Show remaining time for all active timers
4. **Audio Alarms**: Sound notification when timer completes
5. **Persistent State**: Save timer state so they survive application restart
6. **Agent Coordination**: Use Agent Mail for agents to coordinate implementation tasks

## Proposed Solution

Build a terminal-based countdown timer application with:

**Technology Stack**:
- Python or Node.js for the application
- Agent Mail MCP server for agent-to-agent communication
- Sound library for alarms (e.g., playsound, beep, or system notification)
- Simple TUI or CLI interface
- JSON file for persistence

**Agent Mail Usage**:
- Coordinate development tasks between multiple AI agents
- Use message queues to assign subtasks (UI, timer logic, alarm system, etc.)
- Demonstrate asynchronous agent communication patterns

**Features**:
- `timer add <name> <duration>` - Create new timer (e.g., "5m", "2h30m")
- `timer list` - Show all active timers
- `timer pause <name>` - Pause a timer
- `timer resume <name>` - Resume a paused timer
- `timer cancel <name>` - Cancel a timer
- `timer reset <name>` - Reset timer to original duration

## Alternatives Considered

- **Alternative 1**: Build a web-based timer with real-time updates
  - Why not chosen: More complex, focus should be on Agent Mail integration not web development
  
- **Alternative 2**: Simple single-timer application
  - Why not chosen: Too basic, doesn't showcase agent coordination or complex state management
  
- **Alternative 3**: Pomodoro timer specific
  - Why not chosen: Less flexible than general countdown timers

title: Add template usage guidance to bd onboard output
description:
## Feature Request

Update the `bd onboard` command output to include guidance on when and how AI agents should use templates when creating issues.

## Motivation

Currently, `bd onboard` provides comprehensive instructions for AI agents but doesn't mention the template system. This leads to AI agents creating minimal issues without the structured documentation that templates provide. Adding template guidance would:

1. Improve issue quality by encouraging use of structured templates
2. Ensure bugs include reproduction steps and environment details
3. Ensure features capture design decisions and alternatives considered
4. Maintain consistency across issues created by different AI agents

## Use Cases

1. **AI Agent Onboarding**: When a new AI agent runs `bd onboard`, it learns to use templates for bugs, features, and epics automatically
2. **Existing Projects**: Teams can regenerate AGENTS.md with updated best practices by re-running `bd onboard`
3. **Documentation Consistency**: All projects using beads get consistent, high-quality issue documentation

## Proposed Solution

Modify the `bd onboard` command output in two places:

1. **AGENTS.md content**: Update the "Create new issues" section to show template usage:
   ```bash
   # For bugs and features, use templates for structured documentation
   bd create "Bug title" --from-template bug -p 1 --json
   bd create "Feature title" --from-template feature -p 2 --json
   ```

2. **Add Templates section** after "MCP Server" section with:
   - List of available templates (bug, feature, epic)
   - When to use each template
   - When to skip templates (tasks/chores)
   - Template viewing commands

3. **Update Important Rules** to include: "Use templates (`--from-template`) for bugs, features, and epics"

## Alternatives Considered

- **Alternative 1**: Add template suggestions to `bd create` command itself (e.g., prompt "Use --from-template?")
  - Why not chosen: Too intrusive for human users who may prefer quick issue creation
  
- **Alternative 2**: Create separate `bd onboard --with-templates` flag
  - Why not chosen: Splits the onboarding experience; templates should be default best practice
notes:
Reference implementation: This project's AGENTS.md and .github/copilot-instructions.md files contain the exact changes needed.

Upstream repo: https://github.com/steveyegge/beads

Next steps:
1. Fork the beads repository
2. Locate the onboard command source (likely cmd/onboard.go)
3. Apply the template guidance additions shown in this project
4. Test with 'bd onboard' in a fresh directory
5. Submit PR with clear rationale (improves AI agent issue quality)

title: Evaluate daemon and performance
description:
Test bd daemon for background operations, RPC communication, and performance with large issue counts

## Recommended Learning Path

1. **Daemon Basics**
   - Run: `bd daemon status --json` (check if running)
   - Run: `bd daemon start --json` (start daemon)
   - Run: `bd daemon stop --json` (stop daemon)
   - Documentation: https://github.com/steveyegge/beads/blob/main/docs/daemon.md

2. **Daemon Configuration**
   - Run: `bd info --json` (shows daemon connection info)
   - Test: `bd create "Test" --no-daemon --json` (bypass daemon)
   - Check: `bd config get auto-start-daemon --json`
   - Documentation: https://github.com/steveyegge/beads/blob/main/docs/daemon.md#configuration

3. **Multiple Daemons**
   - Run: `bd daemons list --json` (all running daemons)
   - Test multiple project daemons
   - Run: `bd daemons stop-all --json`
   - Documentation: https://github.com/steveyegge/beads/blob/main/docs/daemon.md#multiple-daemons

4. **RPC Communication**
   - Monitor daemon logs during operations
   - Test concurrent operations from multiple terminals
   - Verify background auto-flush
   - Documentation: https://github.com/steveyegge/beads/blob/main/docs/daemon.md#rpc

5. **Performance Testing**
   - Create 100+ issues: `for i in {1..100}; do bd create "Test $i" --json; done`
   - Run: `bd stats --json` (performance with scale)
   - Test: `bd list --json` (query performance)
   - Documentation: https://github.com/steveyegge/beads/blob/main/docs/performance.md

6. **Troubleshooting**
   - Run: `bd doctor --json` (health check)
   - Run: `bd validate --json` (database validation)
   - Check daemon logs for errors
   - Documentation: https://github.com/steveyegge/beads/blob/main/docs/troubleshooting.md

   - Run: `bd hooks install --json` (installs pre-commit/post-merge hooks)
   - Run: `bd hooks status --json` (check hook status)
   - Run: `bd hooks uninstall --json` (remove hooks)
   - Documentation: https://github.com/steveyegge/beads/blob/main/docs/git-integration.md#hooks

2. **Manual Export/Import**
   - Run: `bd export --json` (export to .beads/issues.jsonl)
   - Run: `bd import --json` (import from JSONL)
   - Check: `cat .beads/issues.jsonl | head -5`
   - Documentation: https://github.com/steveyegge/beads/blob/main/docs/jsonl-format.md

3. **Auto-Flush Behavior**
   - Create/update issues and observe 5s debounce
   - Run: `bd info --json` (check flush status)
   - Test: `bd create "Test" --no-auto-flush --json`
   - Documentation: https://github.com/steveyegge/beads/blob/main/docs/auto-sync.md

4. **Sync with Remote**
   - Run: `bd config set sync.branch beads-sync --json`
   - Run: `bd sync --json` (commit and push to sync branch)
   - Run: `bd migrate-sync --json` (migrate to sync workflow)
   - Documentation: https://github.com/steveyegge/beads/blob/main/docs/sync.md

5. **Branch-Aware Tracking**
   - Create branch: `git checkout -b feature-branch`
   - Create issues on branch
   - Test merge behavior with JSONL conflicts
   - Documentation: https://github.com/steveyegge/beads/blob/main/docs/branching.md

6. **Merge Resolution**
   - Run: `bd merge --json` (JSONL merge driver)
   - Run: `bd clean --json` (clean merge artifacts)
   - Documentation: https://github.com/steveyegge/beads/blob/main/docs/merge-conflicts.md

title: test chores
Evaluate workflow commands
description:
Test bd ready, bd blocked, bd stale, and issue status transitions (open/in_progress/done/closed)

## Recommended Learning Path

1. **Status Transitions**
   - Run: `bd update beads-testing-ca1.13 --status in_progress --json`
   - Run: `bd update beads-testing-ca1.13 --status done --json`
   - Run: `bd reopen beads-testing-ca1.13 --json`
   - Documentation: https://github.com/steveyegge/beads/blob/main/docs/status-workflow.md

2. **Finding Ready Work**
   - Run: `bd ready --json` (unblocked, open or in-progress)
   - Run: `bd ready --status open --json` (only open issues)
   - Run: `bd ready --priority 1 --json` (high priority only)
   - Documentation: https://github.com/steveyegge/beads/blob/main/docs/workflow.md#ready-work

3. **Blocked Issues**
   - Run: `bd blocked --json` (all blocked issues)
   - Run: `bd blocked --show-deps --json` (with blocking dependencies)
   - Documentation: https://github.com/steveyegge/beads/blob/main/docs/workflow.md#blocked-issues

4. **Stale Issues**
   - Run: `bd stale --json` (default: 90+ days)
   - Run: `bd stale --days 30 --json` (custom threshold)
   - Run: `bd stale --status in_progress --json` (stale WIP)
   - Documentation: https://github.com/steveyegge/beads/blob/main/docs/maintenance.md#stale-detection

5. **Closing Issues**
   - Run: `bd close beads-testing-ca1.13 --reason "Completed" --json`
   - Run: `bd close beads-testing-ca1.13 --reason "Won't fix" --json`
   - Documentation: https://github.com/steveyegge/beads/blob/main/docs/cli-reference.md#close

6. **Workflow Integration**
   - Run: `bd prime --json` (AI workflow context)
   - Test full workflow: ready → claim → work → complete
   - Documentation: https://github.com/steveyegge/beads/blob/main/docs/ai-workflows.md

title: Evaluate dependency management
description:
Test dependency tracking (blocks/blocked-by/discovered-from), bd dep command, and dependency visualization

## Recommended Learning Path

1. **Basic Dependencies**
   - Create issues with dependencies
   - Run: `bd create "Task A" --json`
   - Run: `bd create "Task B" --deps blocks:beads-testing-ca1.12 --json`
   - Documentation: https://github.com/steveyegge/beads/blob/main/docs/dependencies.md

2. **Dependency Types**
   - Test blocks, blocked-by, discovered-from relationships
   - Run: `bd dep add beads-testing-ca1.12 blocks beads-testing-ca1.13 --json`
   - Run: `bd dep add beads-testing-ca1.12 discovered-from beads-testing-ca1.11 --json`
   - Documentation: https://github.com/steveyegge/beads/blob/main/docs/dependency-types.md

3. **Managing Dependencies**
   - Run: `bd dep list beads-testing-ca1.12 --json`
   - Run: `bd dep remove beads-testing-ca1.12 blocks beads-testing-ca1.13 --json`
   - Run: `bd show beads-testing-ca1.12 --json` (includes dependencies)
   - Documentation: https://github.com/steveyegge/beads/blob/main/docs/cli-reference.md#dep

4. **Blocking Analysis**
   - Run: `bd blocked --json` (show all blocked issues)
   - Run: `bd ready --json` (show unblocked issues)
   - Documentation: https://github.com/steveyegge/beads/blob/main/docs/workflow.md#blocking

5. **Dependency Validation**
   - Run: `bd repair-deps --json` (find orphaned dependencies)
   - Run: `bd validate --json` (comprehensive health check)
   - Documentation: https://github.com/steveyegge/beads/blob/main/docs/maintenance.md

6. **Discovered-From Pattern**
   - Use when finding new work while working on an issue
   - Run: `bd create "Found bug" -p 1 --deps discovered-from:beads-testing-ca1.12 --json`
   - Documentation: https://github.com/steveyegge/beads/blob/main/docs/ai-workflows.md#discovered-work
